column4: will ubuntu 8.10 burn fine on a music cd-r? i don't know what the difference is if there is any
yes
jacobw-uk: then why did it just eject it? :[ told me it probably didn't like the medium
i dont know
a recordable cd is a recordables cd, all types should work
do you know why it's failing optimum power calibration then?
what do you mean by optimum power calibration
k3b says it's trying to calibrate the opimum power
and then it fails and ejects my cd, lol
try a different burn manager?
do you use nautilus for a file manager
yes. i actually got an error when i booted about nautilus that i forgot about. let me see if it's still up
i use nautilus to burn my cd's (mostly linux installs) and it works fine
open system monitor and kill the process bonobo-activation-server, nautilus should work after that
any luck?
how do i open system monitor?
i have a lot of linux expirience but dont really know how
i'll try and figure it out
add a system monitor to one of your panels
system > administration :]
i all ways have one on my panel for watching ram and processor usage
